title: Parts of practice tool not working
body: If you've rebound your left click on your mouse to be your attack move command you cannot use teleport to location or spawn target dummies in the practice tool.  When you click the buttons it assumes you are clicking through them and issuing an a-move onto the map.

replies.body:
A lot of very high elo players and pro's bind the LMB to their attack move, why? well thats a bit obvious
1 it makes SENSE to have it that way.
2 using your RMB to attack is a joke, attack move makes it so you dont just walk into the enemy without trying to bodyslam them while they are assuming you're intentionally trying to feed them.
3 LMB is one of the most important buttons and easily clickable as it is on your mouse right next to your RMB and it is useless by default in combat.
4 in every game your LMB is some sort of attack.

So please just give us an option in the "practice tool settings" to assign our "select" key to something else riot, cause as of right now there's no way around it and it just makes practice tool useless for us.

This is one of the reasons why we don't recommend custom mouse modifications that aren't available in-game. These configurations aren't supported and are prone to causing conflicts in-game like this. I recommend completing a reset of your input settings files with the following steps in order to resolve this conflict. First, **log into the League Client** then navigate to your config folder, which should be in your install directory:

>**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config**

Delete these two files:
**- input.ini
- PersistedSettings.json**

Once you've deleted those files, hop into the Practice Tool so you can check if this worked. Let me know if you have any questions.
